longInfo:
Passport required.
- Passports and other documents accepted for entry must be
  valid for the period of intended stay. 

Visa required, except for A max. stay of 15 days, totaling 90
days within a six month period, for holders of a "C" visa
issued by a Schengen Member State. 
 - Visa must be valid for at least 5 days beyond the period of
   intended stay in Macedonia (FYROM) and must be valid to
   (re-)enter the Schengen Area . It must also be
   valid for all Schengen Member States. Entry into Macedonia
   (FYROM) does not affect the validity of the visa. Used
   single entry Schengen visas are not included.
- Information on Schengen visas  
Minors:
- Unaccompanied passengers under 18 years of age
   
- Minors born abroad to nationals of Macedonia (FYROM) and not
  holding a passport, must 
Additional Information:
- A valid visa in an expired passport
   
Warning:
- Nationals of Uzbekistan are required to hold a biometric
  passport when departing Uzbekistan.
- Visitors not holding return/onward tickets could be refused
  entry
